task.title: Starting and registering the master host (multi-host deployment)

taskbody.context: Use this procedure to start the master host in a multi-host deployment after upgrading to version . This procedure also includes steps to create and register the authentication credentials the master needs for its role as a delegate.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .
Determine whether serviced is configured to start when the system starts.

choices.choice: If the result is enabled, proceed to the next step.
If the result is disabled, enter the following command: systemctl enable serviced

step.cmd: Verify the settings in the serviced configuration file.
Configure the master host to start independent of the ZooKeeper ensemble.
step.info: This step simplifies the process of registering the master host and its effect is temporary—a subsequent step restores the configuration file.

substep.cmd: Create a backup of the serviced configuration file.
Append a new declaration for the SERVICED_ZK variable.

step.cmd: Start serviced, and then monitor the startup.
step.info: During this startup, serviced invokes docker pull to retrieve its updated images.

stepxmp.codeblock: systemctl start serviced && journalctl -u serviced -f -o cat

step.stepresult: Do not proceed to the next step until the following message is displayed: Host Master successfully started

step.cmd: Obtain the host ID of the master host.

substep.cmd: Display the host IDs of all cluster hosts.
Record the host ID of the master host.

step.cmd: Create authentication credentials for the master host, and register the credentials.
step.stepxmp: Replace Host-ID with the host ID of the master host: serviced key reset --register Host-ID

step.cmd: Restore the serviced configuration file, and then restart the service.

stepxmp.codeblock: systemctl daemon-reload && systemctl start serviced \ && journalctl -u serviced -f -o cat

step.cmd: Identify the hosts in the ZooKeeper ensemble.
step.stepresult: The result is a list of 3 or 5 hosts, separated by the comma character (,). The master host is always a node in the ZooKeeper ensemble.
